    • Constructor Detail

      • Object

        public Object(World world,
      double xPos,
      double yPos,
      double radius)
        Constructor to create an object.
        Parameters:
        world - The world the object must be located in.
        xPos - The x-coordinate for the object.
        yPos - The y-coordinate for the object.
        radius - The radius for this object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This position is not valid. | !isValidPos(xPos, yPos);

        public boolean isValidPos(double x,
                 double y)
        This method checks whether a certain position is valid.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate
        y - y-coordinate
        Returns:
        true if both coordinates are numbers. | !Double.isNaN(x) && !Double.isNaN(y)

      • overlaps

        public boolean overlaps(Object object)
        Method to check whether this object overlaps with another object.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to overlap with.
        Returns:
        True if the object overlaps, thus is within the sum of the 2 radiuses away from this object. | (getX() - object.getX()) <= (getRadius() + object.getRadius()) || (getY() - object.getY()) <= (getRadius() + object.getRadius());
